185741977.review:
NOTA: 5.25 de 10

Secuela de las [u][url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/gequi_/recommended/12710/]entregas anteriores[/url][/u] que en general es casi lo mismo. Las novedades más destacables son:

Gráficos y animaciones ligeramente mejorados.

Esbirros se desplazan más rápido, demasiado. Es como si les hubieran metido un torpedo en el trasero. También actúan de forma errática, alejándose y acercándose al "Overlord" como si fueran moscas.

Físicas empeoradas, cuando se destruye algún tipo de construcción y caen trozos de madera o roca, rebotan como el cartón.

Conclusión: deprimente que un juego tan mediocre tenga 81-89% de reseñas positivas.

185514786.review:
A Devilishly Good Adventure with Chaos, Laughter, and Lots of Minions
Overlord 2 is the game where you can finally unleash your dark side – and laugh more than you'd expect during a sinister power grab. Here’s my detailed review:

Positive Aspects:
Dark Humor: The game is brimming with dark humor. From the sarcastic comments of the characters to the exaggerated situations you find yourself in – there’s never a dull moment. Who knew being evil could be so funny?

Minion Mayhem: The small but extremely chaotic minions are the highlight of the game. These little devils turn the battlefield into a mess and create unpredictable and often hilarious moments. It's almost like commanding a horde of hyperactive squirrels.

Moral Flexibility: You have the choice to be a little nice (at least on the surface) or completely evil. Both paths are incredibly entertaining. After all, who doesn’t want to know what it’s like to be the ultimate villain?

Harem Dreams: Yes, in Overlord 2 you can actually have multiple women – a dream come true for some, right? Of course, only in the game context. 😉

Interesting Story: The storyline is captivating and provides enough material to keep you interested until the end. It’s fun to battle through the various chapters and become increasingly powerful.

Revisiting Areas: It’s fun to revisit areas to collect everything and truly leave no stone unturned. There's always something new to discover or destroy.

Negative Aspects:
Controls: The controls could be better and sometimes feel a bit clunky. It’s a challenge to maneuver the camera to keep everything in view.

Minion AI: The AI of the minions is sometimes really questionable. Occasionally, they simply don’t do what they’re supposed to, which can be frustrating. But maybe they’re just cleverly disguised?

Buggy Minions: Occasionally, you encounter bugs affecting the minions. This can disrupt the flow of the game when your little helpers suddenly start acting up. But hey, who needs perfect minions?

Repetitive Tasks: Some missions and tasks repeat and can become monotonous over time. A bit more variety would be welcome.

Florian the Elf: This elfin slacker causes more chaos than your minions! Instead of being useful, Florian just runs around spouting poetic nonsense while you do the real work. Sometimes you wonder if he wouldn’t be better off in a Shakespeare play.

Conclusion:
Overlord 2 is a devilishly good adventure that will delight both fans of the first game and newcomers alike. The mix of dark humor, minion mayhem, and moral flexibility makes it an unforgettable experience. Despite minor flaws like the controls and AI, it’s an experience you won’t soon forget. And if Florian the Elf gets on your nerves again, rest assured your minions are there to bring the battlefield back to order.

Rating: 8/10

185067438.review:
Honestly, a 7/10 game for me:
- Pros: Excellent story, humor, visuals, and music.
- Cons: Clunky controls for PC, mainly when you manually control your minion horde by pressing both mouse buttons which makes certain puzzles (like the spider one) very difficult.

Would reccomend however, a shame Overlord III was never a thing, guess I just replay this one and play the first game as well.

185046952.review:
It's a great game that takes the basics from part one and does everything better.
Timeless graphics, more diversity and some nice additions in the form of vehicles / catapults.

9.3/10

The only thing that they could have left in part 1 is that some things feel a bit grindy. The domination quests, gnome elimination and just gathering gold/souls in general for upgrades feels too slow. It adds a couple of hours to the gameplay, but not hours that I enjoyed spending. Rather just tweak the gold/soul count a bit so you can get decent armour somewhere where it actually matters in the game. I see that a ton of people are using trainers to compensate but it doesn't really add anything to an otherwise awesome game.

184449098.review:
Гра мені сподобалась насамперед своєю механікою керування та взаємодією з міньйонами, до цього я ніколи не грав у щось подібне.
+ Приємний візуальний стиль, для продукту 2009-го року вона виглядає достойно і добре збереглась.
+ Хороший гумор, пародійні відсилання, гра непогано розважає вас як гравця.
+ Різноманітні локації.
+ Дизайн персонажів та монстрів.

+/- Керування, до якого потрібно призвичаїтись та погана робота камери в деяких місцях.

- Гра вийшла трохи затягнутою, як на мене. Деякі місії починають повторюватись, а механіки видихаються під кінець проходження.

В цілому вийшла міцна гра, яка може подарувати вам новий досвід в ігровому процесі. 7.5/10

184321093.review:
5.5/10

Overlord 2 is a good sequel to a bad game. Sadly, it still lacks in many ways and I do not recommend it. In my opinion it is a fundamental problem that stems from the game it wants to be, a humoristic Pikmin-like game in third person with a little more focus on action. The first game showed that this mixture of ideas was suboptimal in execution, and even though this game improves a lot upon the flaws of the first game it still does not reach a satisfying level.

In Overlord 2 you play as a new master of minions, small goblin-like creatures, tasked with taking over the lands from the hands of the corrupt empire. Again, the game asks the question: "You are an evil overlord, but are you more evil than the enemies you are trying to defeat?", which is a good hook plot-wise. Compared to the first game, this game has better level-design, slightly better AI for the minions, a map (which is a godsend) and a few tweaks here and there in order to improve things all around.

That is where the good ends, as the rest is still a slow slog through an awfully written game with terrible dialogue, a camera-perspeictve that just does not work with the whole "commanding not-pikmin to defeat enemies and solve puzzles"-thing. Well, it sort of works, this time around, but it still feels so lackluster. The pacing is very weird and every encounter either feels way too easy or like complete BS. Nothing is ever fun or satisfying, at best the game feels okay. The concept just does not land for me and I keep thinking about how much I love Pikmin and how much this game would have been so much better if it was just... more like Pikmin. However, that is probably protected by Nintendo very agressively, so that is a no-go.

All in all, this game is not terrible but I just cannot recommend it. It does not serve a purpose or fill a void that another game does not fill better. It feels lacking and I had a bad time with it. Go play Pikmin instead and save yourself the money and the time it takes to get through this slow slog.
